channel.title: What does leech mean?
channel.description:
Well, it seems my understanding of the word "leech" differs from a lot of new people, so I'm going to take a few minutes to write the meaning of this word, so it isn't horrifically used as it is. Lets start. Back in the day of Kaitnieks, a leecher was a person to come, download a few SCAR scripts and leave without posting. Now, according to dictionary.com, leech means the following:
2. a person who clings to another for personal gain, esp. without giving anything in return, and usually with the implication or effect of exhausting the other's resources; parasite.
But why did I make this thread? In graphics section, if someone posts an uber sig, some kid with no life has to ruin the posters day by posting the possibility he stole it, usually with "this is leeched". Let me simplify this: "This is a person who takes something for personal gain giving nothing into return", this can mean a lot of things, now, onto the second word of the day, "rip", if someone rips a sig, they simply put their name on it. Lets look at the definition for "rip" on dictionary.com:
[b]9. Rip off, Slang.[/b] a. to steal or pilfer. b. to rob or steal from. c. to swindle, cheat, or exploit; take advantage of: phony charity appeals that rip off a gullible public.
Now, lets say someone posted an uber sig, and the person that said leech before, now said "this is ripped", I'll simplify that, "This person stole that sig". [b]Conclusion:[/b] If you want to be a noob, and moronically submit your claim of theft, use the correct words.

item.title: What does leech mean?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:25, topic:121835”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=171433.msg1585310#msg1585310 date=1184127909]

You seem pretty pissed.

The use of “this is leeched” emerged at moparscape boards and migrated to here like a flock of birds, sure, it’s one thing saying the general moparscaper isn’t fully educated in English skills but it’s getting annoying when it constantly pops up.

Sure, blatant claims of stolen sigs(sigs is my example) is fine, but how on earth can you leech a sig?
[/quote]

Its not only used in Moparscape and here… It has been going around hacking websites for a while…[/quote]

I mean, from here emerging from moparscape. I know we’re not the only ones that use it/have stupid idots that use it.

Read full topic

Sure, blatant claims of stolen sigs(sigs is my example) is fine, but how on earth can you leech a sig?[/quote]
Leech is someone who “sucks” the life or property from another person in order to survive or make themselves feel alive. Exactly like a real life leech.

item.title: What does leech mean?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

therealjdb:

Yeah lol I understood that hah i was just trying to think of an example of sig leeching. xD

Heh, and I was trying to prove that it was useless to use the word leech.

Read full topic

item.title: What does leech mean?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:20, topic:121835”][quote author=therealjdb link=topic=171433.msg1591359#msg1591359 date=1184294028]

Noo, that wouldn’t be leeching the sig that would be ripping.

Either way it’s ripping. ‘Leeching’ a sig, as you define it, has the same effect as ripping a sig, therefore should not deserve a different name. Regardless, in graphics forums, there is no way to tell the difference between a ‘leeched’ sig and a ripped sig. Therefore, all stolen sigs are ripped, and there is no way to ‘leech’ a sig.

Ripping is passing the sig on as your own whereas leeching it would just be taking it for personal use, such as a background picture etc…
[/quote]

No no no, I used sigs as an example, let me try and make it a bit more simple:

Respected Sig Owner: Here’s my sig. Uber sig
Noob: Omg that’s leeched! It’s too good! You couldn’t have made that! Leecher!
Everyone: Sigh[/quote]
Yeah lol I understood that hah i was just trying to think of an example of sig leeching. xD

Read full topic

item.title: What does leech mean?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“therealjdb, post:18, topic:121835”][quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=171433.msg1590367#msg1590367 date=1184275684]

Noo, that wouldn’t be leeching the sig that would be ripping.

Either way it’s ripping. ‘Leeching’ a sig, as you define it, has the same effect as ripping a sig, therefore should not deserve a different name. Regardless, in graphics forums, there is no way to tell the difference between a ‘leeched’ sig and a ripped sig. Therefore, all stolen sigs are ripped, and there is no way to ‘leech’ a sig.
[/quote]
Ripping is passing the sig on as your own whereas leeching it would just be taking it for personal use, such as a background picture etc…[/quote]

No no no, I used sigs as an example, let me try and make it a bit more simple:

Respected Sig Owner: Here’s my sig. Uber sig
Noob: Omg that’s leeched! It’s too good! You couldn’t have made that! Leecher!
Everyone: Sigh

Read full topic

item.title: What does leech mean?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

therealjdb:

Ripping is passing the sig on as your own whereas leeching it would just be taking it for personal use, such as a background picture etc…

I find it extremely improbable that an image intended for a signature could be used as wallpaper. And as it stands, those graphics stealers are still rippers, yes? And if it is for personal use, there would be no way to identify a leecher?

And for the most part, there is no reason to delineate between a graphics ripper and a graphics leecher. There is no advantage for distinguishing between the two camps, and using an arbitrary word in a debatable application is simply asking for misinterpretation.

Read full topic

Regardless, in graphics forums, there is no way to tell the difference between a ‘leeched’ sig and a ripped sig. Therefore, all stolen sigs are ripped, and there is no way to ‘leech’ a sig.[/quote]
Ripping is passing the sig on as your own whereas leeching it would just be taking it for personal use, such as a background picture etc…

item.title: What does leech mean?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

w00tz0r pwnz:

Barrowing??

Yes, that’s the correct way to spell borrowing. Because you’re going to give the sig back later after you’re down masturbating over it.

gokon:

in the case of a sig, to “leech” it is to take and possibly use it without giving any comment on it or credits to the creator of the sig. to “rip” the sig would be to take and possibly use the sig, maybe make some sort of comment on it, and to still not give any credits to the creator. both of these are without persission. to “(im not sure of the word for it)” is to take and possibly use the sig with permission of the creator and unless the creator said you did not have to, give credits to the creator.

I guess you didn’t understand a word of my post, did you?

Read full topic

item.title: What does leech mean?
item.dc:creator: @w00tz0r_pwnz w00tz0r pwnz
item.description:
@w00tz0r_pwnz wrote:

Another easier example is sources. A lot of times if you look at the moparscape server status page and try a server it has nothing added to it compared to the source that was used. That would be leeching.

This is helpful for someone new if they posted something and someone else said it was leeched and they didn’t know what this meant. After reading this they would know.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:

redragonje65:

I think that when you leech a file that you’ve downloaded it means that you decide not to be someone who other people download the file from. Seeded and leached are the 2 options so I guess they could be opposite.

You’re talking about it from a BT point of view. Un-named is speaking from a common point of view, that of using a community without giving back to it.
